result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 11/1/2022 from defendant regarding bail modification.
Inmate Communication Form requesting Huber Bailee Status sent to Branch 2 and Branch 7

Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Broze.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/31/2022 - The bail motion will be addressed at the upcoming 11/9 hearing.**

10:07 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing. Defendant Christopher Jozeph Szuhar in court, in custody.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Christopher Jozeph Szuhar.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Broze presents arguments; she is requesting bail be modified to a signature bond or the court allow Huber Bailee status.  State objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Broze presents additional statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court will tag this matter along with the defendant's other cases set for 11/09/2022.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:22 AM Defendant Christopher Jozeph Szuhar in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abigail Broze appears as friend of the court and is asking for her appointment to be extended to this matter. The Court will extend Attorney Broze's appointment to this matter. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. The date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Broze.
